title: Web - Login - App crashes when login to HT account

comments.body:
:wave: Friendly reminder that deploy blockers are time-sensitive ⏱ issues! [Check out the open \`StagingDeployCash\` deploy checklist](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AStagingDeployCash) to see the list of PRs included in this release, then work quickly to do one of the following:

1. Identify the pull request that introduced this issue and revert it.
2. Find someone who can quickly fix the issue.
3. Fix the issue yourself.

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

comments.body:
📣 @github-actions[bot]! 📣
Hey, it seems we don’t have your contributor details yet! You'll only have to do this once, and this is how we'll hire you on Upwork.
Please follow these steps:
1. Make sure you've read and understood the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md).
2. Get the email address used to login to your Expensify account. If you don't already have an Expensify account, create one [here](https://new.expensify.com/). If you have multiple accounts (e.g. one for testing), please use your main account email.
3. Get the link to your Upwork profile. It's necessary because we only pay via Upwork. You can access it by logging in, and then clicking on your name. It'll look like [this](https://www.upwork.com/freelancers/~01ca8ad8ce36b9eceb). If you don't already have an account, sign up for one [here](https://www.upwork.com/nx/signup/?dest=home).
4. Copy the format below and paste it in a comment on this issue. Replace the placeholder text with your actual details.
![Screen Shot 2022-11-16 at 4 42 54 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30609178/231263719-a8a3b7d3-36a0-4d7f-8ad4-cebe1f560fa4.png)
Format:
```
Contributor details
Your Expensify account email: <REPLACE EMAIL HERE>
Upwork Profile Link: <REPLACE LINK HERE>
```
Triggered auto assignment to @aldo-expensify (`Engineering`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4319 for more details.
@kbecciv do you have any crash log or console error?
I suspect it might be coming from this PR - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31711. Gonna try to help @aldo-expensify reproduce this issue first

Hmm actually, I'm seeing the crash log below without a HT account

![Screenshot 2023-11-23 at 3 18 02 PM](https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/22219519/f652262f-667c-4db6-95b4-b0ecb58af00d)
Seems like what @quinthar reported [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1700768086040859)
Seems to come from this line https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/1163dc3837dfb04a985f3106026ede7b77108cca/src/libs/OptionsListUtils.js#L396
https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31061 is candidate
Yea, I'm trying to reproduce in dev

> Seems to come from this line
> 
> https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/1163dc3837dfb04a985f3106026ede7b77108cca/src/libs/OptionsListUtils.js#L396

For this to happen, we would need to fail to find the IOU here

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/36105a3d62c54b5430f674dc1d7ec3b7752ab8ae/src/libs/OptionsListUtils.js#L425-L431

correct, this is the data I have. You can see that the reportID doesn't exist in `allSortedReportActions` and `lastIOUMoneyReport` is undefined

![Screenshot 2023-11-23 at 3 52 53 PM](https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/22219519/e2a2c6b6-de3b-44d8-872c-871982305d85)

Reproduced:

1. Have 2 accounts logged in different sessions and start a chat between them
2. Request money from one of them
3. The other received the pusher event and crash

Going to check if this happens in production

hmm I have been only able to reproduce in dev, but not ~staging/~production

Reproduced in staging.
hmm, pusher events are not working anymore in my env...
I have a fix for it here - https://github.com/Expensify/Web-Expensify/pull/39825

This is the pusher events that cause the things to explode:

```
{
    "updates": [
        {

                },
                {

                                }
                            ],
                            "originalMessage": {

                            },

                            "reportActionID": "5628178967538067842",
                            "reportActionTimestamp": 1700781075408,

    "lastUpdateID": "7550",
    "previousUpdateID": "7544"

```

We can see here:

- `REPORTPREVIEW` is inserted to onyx in key `reportActions_5721531069860615`. This has `"linkedReportID": "3759538206565919"`
- In the same Onyx event, another update inserts the IOU report `3759538206565919`

I think the problem is that the `REPORTPREVIEW` gets inserted causing a re-render before the IOU report is inserted. I think we should just update the front end code so it doesn't crash and display something else while we don't find the IOU report
Sounds good, wanna work on a fix?
@luacmartins what are your thoughts on: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31806 🙏
hmm but in the log I linked above iouReport is defined, we just don't have any reportAction for it in Onyx

> hmm but in the log I linked above iouReport is defined, we just don't have any reportAction for it in Onyx

Which log? ~this? https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31803#issuecomment-1824979383~

This one https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31803#issuecomment-1824964452, right? the `iouReport` is "defined" only because `ReportUtils.getReport` returns `{}` and not `null/undefined` when it doesn't find a report.

I 100% disagree with `ReportUtils.getReport` returning `{}` in when reports are not found because it is prone to cause confusion IMO, but this is out of scope :P

When I reproduced, `iouReport` was not found and then `ReportUtils.getReport` returns `{}`. I mean this line:

```
const iouReport = ReportUtils.getReport(ReportActionUtils.getIOUReportIDFromReportActionPreview(lastReportAction));
```

and `ReportActionUtils.getIOUReportIDFromReportActionPreview(lastReportAction)` returns correctly the reportID of the IOU

> correct, this is the data I have. You can see that the reportID doesn't exist in `allSortedReportActions` and `lastIOUMoneyReport` is undefined
> 
> 
> 
> ![Screenshot 2023-11-23 at 3 52 53 PM](https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/22219519/e2a2c6b6-de3b-44d8-872c-871982305d85)
> 
> 

I logged this when logging into my account in staging. We can see a full iouReport there and it's present in Onyx, but that same report has no reportAction in Onyx
and did it crash that time you logged in? The version of the crash I reproduced doesn't happen after login in, maybe it can happen in more than one way?
Yes, it did crash. I'm in mobile but I can record a video when I get back

I think it would be good to know in your case if the `reportActions` for the IOU load at some point, regardless of the crash. If it is just that during that render they were not available, but in the next one they would have been, the fix in the PR https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31806 would work. If the `reportActions` never load, then it is a different problem
They never seemed to load because refreshing the page didn't fix the issue. So maybe we do have multiple issues here.

> They never seemed to load because refreshing the page didn't fix the issue. So maybe we do have multiple issues here.

😢

I see that the reportActions for the IOU come in the OpenApp request for me when I login. I'll check the backend code and see if I can find a case where we don't load these reportActions.

This happens here: https://github.com/Expensify/Web-Expensify/blob/b4059988c7f937e62ed55a5f992d1483e9f664f2/lib/AppInit.php#L77-L86

I think the reportAction is loaded here as a "parentReportAction":

https://github.com/Expensify/Auth/blob/160e6ceabd124a9b0b6442d0d09538ad91e22e33/auth/lib/Report.cpp#L5251-L5255

I wonder if your report causing this is old and there is some data missing that causes this.
Does your IOU have a `parentReportActionID`?

hmm login in into the account having the issue here could help with debugging, but I'm getting a [second verification](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C9YU7BX5M/p1700787750319769) that I can't pass

Here's a video. Refreshing the page results in the same error:

https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/22219519/d4b232c4-85e2-478d-a9a0-0f46419c3772

Hmm my call to OpenApp doesn't return reportActions for that reportID 8668808441392607:

![Screenshot 2023-11-23 at 6 13 36 PM](https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/22219519/141f3609-d2de-4c3f-9834-325b323b7f90)

I have been debugging the account [applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com](mailto:applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com)

And I think I have narrowed down the problematic report to:

```
[
    {
        "reportID": 4259526448723151,
        "isPinned": false,
        "isThread": true,
        "isArchivedRoom": false,
        "type": "expense",
        "chatType": null,
        "parentReportActionID": "2332071123794222759",
        "parentReportID": "3003828422686844",
        "isOwnPolicyExpenseChat": false,
        "lastRead": "2023-10-09 19:26:04.831",
        "lastActionCreated": "2023-10-26 19:52:25.210",
        "reportName": "Request",
        "sharedReportList": [
            {
                "accountID": 11357510,
                "email": "applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com",
                "permissions": "read, write"
            },
            {
                "accountID": 7976487,
                "email": "andres.serna@team.expensify.com",
                "permissions": "read, write"
            }
        ],
        "participants": [
            "andres.serna@team.expensify.com",
            "applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com"
        ],
        "managerID": 0,
        "managerEmail": "__fake__",
        "lastActionType": "IOU",
        "ownerAccountID": 11124256,
        "reportNameValuePairs": {
            "expensify_policyID": "8F5F364CB02B8264",
            "lastNotifiedReportActionTimestamp": "2023-10-26 19:52:25.210",
            "lastReadTime_11357510": "2023-10-09 19:26:04.831",
            "lastReadTime_7976487": "2023-10-26 19:52:25.210",
            "oldPolicyName": "",
            "parentReportActionID": "2332071123794222759",
            "parentReportID": "3003828422686844",
            "type": "expense"
        },
        "state": 2,
        "status": 4
    }
]
```

This the only expense/iou report that has managerID = 0, which would cause the code to try to access `reportAction.actorAccountID` in the line `report.managerID || reportAction.actorAccountID`

This report is in a free workspace, so I'll try to play with that to see if it happens. What kind of report is it in you case @luacmartins ?

There are two things that are unexpected and I haven't been able to replicate:

1. Expense report in a workspace with managerID = 0, how did it lose the manager?
2. reportActions not loading for an iou/expense report during OpenApp

uggh I think I found something that was confusing me a lot. Somehow, the code [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/87608953848bbbc2a6c9958cdc2d06a9a0e2ff39/src/libs/OptionsListUtils.js#L429-L436) was able to find the IOU reportActions, even when they were not in Onyx

Now I see that we have this collection `allSortedReportActions` that we never clean up, not even during logout, so I had dirty data there from previous sessions:

https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/20223/files#diff-733528d957ae6a80eb863637fa5d54278c89c6121998f3574fa8c0aba935daebR90

> reportActions not loading for an iou/expense report during OpenApp

I was able to cause this by removing the `parentReportActionID` NVPs that pointed to the IOU action of the iou/expense report. This `parentReportActionID` is tied to the chat report we create per transaction. If you clean it, then OpenApp doesn't load anymore the reportActions for the iou/expense report.

This is not enough to cause the crash, we also need the managerID to be 0.
Its the end of the day here, I'll continue tomorrow, this is a deploy blocker, but I don't think we plan to deploy tomorrow and is not a main flow I believe.

Hi! Coming from https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31061. Sorry that my PR caused the problem. Now I can recreate this issue only when creating a new chat (a newly created account requesting money from HT). I totally missed this case and I didn't have any problems for the other scenarios while testing. I saw that aldo opened this PR https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31806. Should I additionaly open a PR with the change @situchan mentions https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31061#discussion_r1403771183 ?
@mountiny draft PR opened https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/31817

⚠️ Looks like this issue was linked to a **Deploy Blocker** [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31814)

If you are the assigned CME please investigate whether the linked PR caused a regression and leave a comment with the results.

If a regression has occurred and you are the assigned CM follow the instructions [here](https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/13647).

If this regression could have been avoided please consider also proposing a recommendation to the PR checklist so that we can avoid it in the future.
should I mark the PR ready for review? I've also tested the case with workspace - the fix works fine
Thanks @koko57 and @mountiny for fixing it!

I logged in with the account [applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com](mailto:applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com) and it didn't crash

I also verified that the expense report  `4259526448723151` doesn't have reportActions and that its managerID is 0, so I think this is the case when it crashes at login.
And thanks @luacmartins for the help yesterday! and @situchan for investigating!

⚠️ Looks like this issue was linked to a **Deploy Blocker** [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31833)

If you are the assigned CME please investigate whether the linked PR caused a regression and leave a comment with the results.

If a regression has occurred and you are the assigned CM follow the instructions [here](https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/13647).

If this regression could have been avoided please consider also proposing a recommendation to the PR checklist so that we can avoid it in the future.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 1.4.3.0
**Reproducible in staging?:** y
**Reproducible in production?:** n
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team
**Slack conversation:**

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Login with HT account - [applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com](mailto:applausetester+mnchat1@applause.expensifail.com)

## Expected Result:
Verify the UI has a loading "skeleton" state (offline avatar and placeholder lines) and loads after a few moments and the loading state is not visible anymore

## Actual Result:
App crashes

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
<!---
Check off any platforms that are affected by this issue
--->
Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on?
- [ ] Android: Native
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: Native
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
- [ ] MacOS: Desktop

## Screenshots/Videos

Add any screenshot/video evidence


https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/906ac3af-4d84-4cbf-9e5c-0234f4118394



[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
